Uses of Class
pisces.d.FPMath

  • Packages that use FPMath 
    Package Description
    pisces  
    pisces.d  
    pisces.m  

    • Uses of FPMath in pisces

      Subclasses of FPMath in pisces 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Path 
      class  Polygon
      Closed polygon
      static class  Polygon.Rectangle 
      static class  Polygon.Square 

    • Uses of FPMath in pisces.d

      Subclasses of FPMath in pisces.d 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Dasher
      The Dasher class takes a series of linear commands (moveTo, lineTo, close and end) and breaks them into smaller segments according to a dash pattern array and a starting dash phase.
      class  Flattener
      The Flattener class rewrites a general path, which may include curved segments, into one containing only linear segments suitable for sending to a LineSink.
      class  FXMath
      S15.16 fixed point
      class  LineSink
      The LineSink interface accepts a series of line drawing commands: moveTo, lineTo, close (equivalent to a lineTo command with an argument equal to the argument of the last moveTo command), and end.
      class  Paint
      Rendering plugin works on fixed point (S15.16) coordinate values.
      class  PathSink
      The LineSink interface extends the PathSink interface, and additionally accepts curve drawing commands: quadTo and curveTo.
      class  PathStore
      Reproducible path sink
      class  Pisces
      Floating point user interface (package driver).
      class  Renderer
      The backend blender is Blit.
      class  RendererBase 
      class  Stroker 
      class  Transformer 

    • Uses of FPMath in pisces.m

      Subclasses of FPMath in pisces.m 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AxisAngle
      A four-element axis angle represented by double-precision floating point x,y,z,angle components.
      class  Matrix
      A double precision floating point 3 by 3 matrix in row major notation.
      class  Point
      A 3 element point that is represented by double precision floating point x,y,z coordinates.
      class  Quat
      A 4-element quaternion represented by double precision floating point x,y,z,w coordinates.
      class  Tuple
      A generic 3-element tuple that is represented by double-precision floating point x,y,z coordinates.
      class  Vector
      A 3-element vector that is represented by double-precision floating point x,y,z coordinates.
